properties.name: author
properties.description: Mission author's name. The default loading screen shows this string below the onLoadName in a smaller font prefixed by "by ".

properties.name: onLoadName
properties.description: String (usually mission name) shown during mission loading. The string is shown in a slightly larger font above the loadScreen. The onLoadMission text is placed below the load screen and the header gameType determines the game type on top of the box.

properties.name: onLoadMission
properties.description:
Displays a message while the mission is loading. Note that a mission that takes very little time to load will only display the message for a short time.
In OFP:CWC this is the name you see when selecting a mission in MP and also the name that is presented to the Multiplayer browser.

properties.name: loadScreen
properties.description:
The picture to be shown while the mission is loaded. The path is relative to the mission folder. Must be in PAA file format.
2:1 aspect ratio (different aspect are rendered correctly as well, but won't cover the whole area).
Ideally 1024x512 pixels.

properties.name: header
properties.description: This class defines mission type and other settings displayed in the multiplayer browser.

properties.name: onLoadIntro
properties.description: Displays a message while the intro is loading.

properties.name: onLoadMissionTime
properties.description: Define whether you will see the time and date displayed while the mission loads. Effect unkown in Arma 3.

properties.name: onLoadIntroTime
properties.description: Define whether you will see the time and date displayed while the intro loads.

properties.name: briefingName
properties.description: Mission name displayed in the mission selection menu.

properties.name: CfgLoadingTexts
properties.description: Define mission specific loading texts.

properties.name: overviewPicture
properties.description: Path to image which will be displayed when the mission is highlighted on the mission selection screen. Image should be .paa format and in 2:1 aspect ratio â€“ ideally 1024x512 (Arma 3).

properties.name: overviewText
properties.description: Text to be displayed below the overviewPicture on the mission selection screen when the mission is available to play.

properties.name: overviewTextLocked
properties.description: Text to be displayed below the overviewPicture on the mission selection screen when the mission is locked from play.

properties.name: onBriefingGear
properties.description: Defines a sound (defined in CfgSounds) that will play when accessing the gear part of the briefing. See Briefing.html.

properties.name: onBriefingGroup
properties.description: Defines a sound (defined in CfgSounds) that will play when accessing the group part of the briefing. See Briefing.html.

properties.name: onBriefingPlan
properties.description: Defines a sound (defined in CfgSounds) that will play when accessing the plan part of the briefing. See Briefing.html.

properties.name: respawn
properties.description: Sets respawn type.

properties.name: respawnButton
properties.description: Enable or disable the respawn button in the menu for INSTANT and BASE respawn types.

properties.name: respawnDelay
properties.description: Set respawn delay in seconds.

properties.name: respawnVehicleDelay
properties.description: Set vehicle respawn delay in seconds.

properties.name: respawnDialog
properties.description: Show the scoreboard and respawn countdown timer for a player if he is killed with respawn type 3.

properties.name: respawnOnStart
properties.description: Respawn player when he joins the game. Available only for INSTANT and BASE respawn types.

properties.name: respawnTemplates
properties.description: Respawn templates from CfgRespawnTemplates. You can combine any number of them together.

properties.name: respawnWeapons
properties.description: Set weapons players will receive upon respawn. respawnMagazines has to be defined as well.

properties.name: respawnMagazines
properties.description: Set magazines players will receive upon respawn. respawnWeapons has to be defined as well.

properties.name: reviveMode
properties.description: Define if Revive mode is enabled.

properties.name: reviveUnconsciousStateMode
properties.description: Define revive mode.

properties.name: reviveRequiredTrait
properties.description: Define if only a medic (or unit with medic trait) can perform a revive.

properties.name: reviveRequiredItems
properties.description: Define if a medical item (first aid kit or medkit) is required to begin a revive process.

properties.name: reviveRequiredItemsFakConsumed
properties.description: Define if a first aid kit is consumed on reviving a teammate

properties.name: reviveMedicSpeedMultiplier
properties.description: Speed multiplier for revive performed by medic

properties.name: reviveDelay
properties.description: The time in seconds it takes to revive an incapacitated unit. Having a Medikit will halve this time.

properties.name: reviveForceRespawnDelay
properties.description: The time in seconds it takes for an incapacitated unit to force their respawn.

properties.name: reviveBleedOutDelay
properties.description: The time in seconds it takes for a unit to bleed out.

properties.name: enablePlayerAddRespawn
properties.description: Usage unsure, may be related to respawn template MenuPosition.

properties.name: CfgRespawnInventory
properties.description:
This class defines a respawn inventory, used with MenuInventory respawn template.
Loadouts with no assigned role are automatically assigned to the "Default" role.
See also BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory, BIS_fnc_removeRespawnInventory

properties.name: CfgRespawnTemplates
properties.description: This class defines new respawn templates to be used with respawn templates.

properties.name: CfgRoles
properties.description:
This class defines Respawn roles. The main purpose of Roles is to make things clearer and simpler for player when selecting a loadout. All the loadouts available in a mission are now divided into various roles.
Mission designer can use roles already created in the game config, or custom roles can be defined in description.ext file. Loadouts with no role assigned are automatically assigned to the Default role.

properties.name: keys
properties.description: List of keys from which keysLimit counts the done ones.

properties.name: keysLimit
properties.description: Number of keys from the keys list needed done to unlock (and be able to play) this mission.

properties.name: doneKeys
properties.description: Name of keys marked done on mission completion.

properties.name: overrideFeedback
properties.description: Some of the feedback effects in Arma 3 are scripted and executed by functions_f\feedback\fn_feedbackMain.fsm. Those include being hit, pulsation, dirt from explosion, choking etc. Adding overrideFeedback with value > 0 will stop feedback FSM from executing, allowing mission/mod makers to script their own, custom effects. The param is first checked in the mission config and then mod config. If mission config has this param set to 0, it will force default feedback handling without possibility to override it by mods. Do not set this param unless you are planning to enforce feedback one way or another.

properties.name: showHUD
properties.description: Enables/Disables the following IGUI elements:

properties.name: showCompass
properties.description: Defines if the compass is visible.

properties.name: showGPS
properties.description: Enables/Disables the GPS.

properties.name: showGroupIndicator
properties.description:
Changes default GPS mini map into a radar like display that indicates group members relative position to the player.
See also BIS_fnc_groupIndicator

properties.name: showMap
properties.description: Defines if the map is shown after the mission starts.

properties.name: showNotePad
properties.description: In ArmA, defines if the NotePad is shown after the mission starts.

properties.name: showPad
properties.description: Defines if the NotePad is shown after the mission starts. Only in OFP:CWC.

properties.name: showWatch
properties.description: Defines if the watch is visible.

properties.name: showUAVFeed
properties.description: Enables/Disables the UAV Feed.

properties.name: showSquadRadar
properties.description: Defines if the Squad Radar is visible.

properties.name: weapons
properties.description: Set weapons available to players during the briefing.

properties.name: magazines
properties.description: Set magazines available to players during the briefing.

properties.name: backpacks
properties.description: Set backpacks available to players during the briefing.

properties.name: allowSubordinatesTakeWeapons
properties.description: Allows subordinates (i.e., not leaders) to equip items defined in weapons, magazines and backpacks.

properties.name: arsenalRestrictedItems
properties.description: Used to blacklist undesired Arsenal equipment, which prevents user saved loadout from being loaded if it contains restricted items.

properties.name: corpseManagerMode
properties.description: Sets the mode for corpse removal manager.

properties.name: corpseLimit
properties.description: Corpse limit before which ( <= ) corpseRemovalMaxTime applies and after which ( > ) corpseRemovalMinTime applies.

properties.name: corpseRemovalMinTime
properties.description: Remove all bodies that have been dead longer than corpseRemovalMinTime when corpseLimit is reached.

properties.name: corpseRemovalMaxTime
properties.description: Maximum time a corpse can remain on the ground if total number of corpses is equal or under corpseLimit.

properties.name: wreckManagerMode
properties.description: Sets the mode for wreck removal manager.

properties.name: wreckLimit
properties.description: Vehicle wreck limit before which ( <= ) wreckRemovalMaxTime applies and after which ( > ) wreckRemovalMinTime applies .

properties.name: wreckRemovalMinTime
properties.description: Remove all wrecks that have existed longer than wreckRemovalMinTime when wreckLimit is breached.

properties.name: wreckRemovalMaxTime
properties.description: Maximum time a wreck can remain on the ground if total number of wrecks is equal or under wreckLimit.

properties.name: minPlayerDistance
properties.description: The minimum distance between corpse or wreck and nearest player before the corpse or wreck is allowed to be removed by the garbage collector.

properties.name: titleParam%, valuesParam%, defValueParam%, textParam%
properties.description:
titleParam1 and titleParam2 (% in title is replaced either by 1 or 2) are multiplayer options.
These options are seen in the lobby of a multiplayer game.
They can be useful for setting time limits and score limits in such games as Capture the Flag and Death Matches.
Other popular uses include accelerate time, setting the mission difficulty or switching the intro on/off.

properties.name: params
properties.description:
These are Multiplayer parameters, available in the lobby by the server administrator.
They are intended as a replacement for param1/param2.

properties.name: aiKills
properties.description: Enables AI units score to appear in score table.

properties.name: briefing
properties.description: Skip briefing screen for SP missions. If no briefing.html is present, it is skipped anyway.

properties.name: debriefing
properties.description: Defines if the debriefing is shown or not at the end of the mission.

properties.name: CfgDebriefing
properties.description: Define custom mission endings or override the default endings (found under CfgDebriefing in the game's config file).

properties.name: CfgDebriefingSections
properties.description: Define custom sections to be displayed on the debriefing screen. Useful for custom scoring systems or displaying player achievements.

properties.name: disableChannels
properties.description: Disable global, side, command or system chat. MOTD and admin say have exception and will show in global.

properties.name: disabledAI
properties.description:
Multiplayer setting that removes all playable units which do not have a human player.
When AI is disabled, a player logging out will not have AI take control of his character.

properties.name: disableRandomization
properties.description: Disables randomization on certain objects, object types or object kinds in the mission. For more information visit: Vehicle Customization (VhC)

properties.name: enableDebugConsole
properties.description: Allows access to the Debug Console outside of the editor during normal gameplay.

properties.name: enableItemsDropping
properties.description: Disable dropping items while swimming. Introduced in Arma 2 OA BETA 1.60.93965. Doesn't seem to have any effect in Arma 3.

properties.name: enableTeamSwitch
properties.description: Enables or disables Team Switch functionality in MP when respawn type is 5 (SIDE).

properties.name: forceRotorLibSimulation
properties.description: Force enable or disable RotorLib flight model.

properties.name: joinUnassigned
properties.description:
By default a new player is not auto assigned a free playable slot in the mission lobby in Multiplayer.
Disable this setting to make him auto assigned to the side with least players.

properties.name: minScore, avgScore, maxScore
properties.description:
Set minimum, average and maximum score for your mission.
Score is related to the star display in the debriefing screen (OFP:CWC).
The score can be influenced during a missions progress by using the addRating command.

properties.name: onCheat
properties.description: Executes custom statement when player enters GETALLGEAR cheat (see: GETALLGEAR).

properties.name: onPauseScript
properties.description:
Executes a custom SQF script or function in scheduled environment (execVM) when player brings up Game Pause screen (presses 'Esc' button).
Display parameter of the resulting dialog is available via (_this select 0) inside the script.

properties.name: saving
properties.description: Toggle saving possibility.

properties.name: scriptedPlayer
properties.description: When scripted player is enabled, game no longer shows "No player select" error message upon mission start when no player unit is present.

properties.name: skipLobby
properties.description: When enabled, joining player will join the mission bypassing role selection screen. The joinUnassigned param will be set to 1 automatically, so that player receives first available role from mission template. When leaving such mission, player will go straight back to server browser.

properties.name: allowFunctionsLog
properties.description: Allows functions to log to the RPT file.

properties.name: allowFunctionsRecompile
properties.description:
As a security measure, functions are by default protected against rewriting during mission.
This restriction does not apply in missions previewed from the editor.

properties.name: CfgRemoteExec
properties.description: Define remoteExec and remoteExecCall restrictions. See CfgRemoteExec for more detailed explanations and examples.

properties.name: CfgDisabledCommands
properties.description: Define disabled script commands. See CfgDisabledCommands for more detailed explanations.

properties.name: taskManagement_markers2D
properties.description: Use new 2D markers.

properties.name: taskManagement_markers3D
properties.description: Use new 3D markers.

properties.name: taskManagement_propagate
properties.description: Propagate shared tasks to subordinates.

properties.name: taskManagement_drawDist
properties.description: 3D marker maximum draw distance in meters. within this range, unassigned tasks are drawn on screen.

properties.name: CfgTasks
properties.description: Agents task config

properties.name: CfgTaskTypes
properties.description: Define Task types and their icons.

properties.name: CfgTaskDescriptions
properties.description: Define Task titles and descriptions.

properties.name: CfgTaskEnhancements
properties.description: Defines tasks enhancements directly in a class.

properties.name: import
properties.description: It is possible to import a class from main config and inherit from it in mission config. For example:

properties.name: CfgCameraEffects
properties.description: Configure custom cameraEffect.

properties.name: CfgCommunicationMenu
properties.description: This entry allows to add commanding menu option in the communication menu. See Arma 3 Communication Menu for more information.

properties.name: CfgCommands
properties.description: This entry contains a list of configurations for certain scripting commands (currently only allowedHTMLLoadURIs for htmlLoad and ctrlSetURL). Can be defined in Config.cpp or in campaign's or mission's Description.ext; the most local variant is used.

properties.name: CfgFunctions
properties.description: Define functions for your mission. See Functions Library for more detailed information.

properties.name: CfgHints
properties.description: Define Advanced Hints (similar to the Field Manual ones). See Advanced Hints for more information.

properties.name: CfgIdentities
properties.description:
Define the identities of individual units, you can specify the face, type of glasses worn, voice, tone of voice and name of an identity.
You then give a specific unit this identity by using the command setIdentity in the mission.
NOTE: nameSound is only valid since Arma 3. See setNameSound for possible values.

properties.name: CfgLeaflets
properties.description: Define leaflets for your missions. See Arma 3 Leaflets for more information.

properties.name: CfgMusic
properties.description: Defines music you can play with playMusic.

properties.name: CfgNotifications
properties.description: Define custom notifications to be shown with BIS_fnc_showNotification. See Notification for more detailed information and examples.

properties.name: CfgPostprocessTemplates
properties.description:
Define custom post-process effects, to Post process effects format (only "colorCorrection" and "filmGrain" are supported for now).
To be used with BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate.

properties.name: CfgRadio
properties.description: Defines radio sentences you can play with these radio commands: customRadio, vehicleRadio, groupRadio, sideRadio, globalRadio.

properties.name: CfgSentences
properties.description: See Conversations for more information.

properties.name: CfgSFX
properties.description: See CfgSFX for more information.

properties.name: CfgSounds
properties.description:
General sounds that can be used for dialog, voiceovers in the briefing etc.
See also commands playSound, say, say2D and say3D.

properties.name: CfgUnitInsignia
properties.description: Define custom unit insignia (shoulder patches). See Arma 3 Unit Insignia for more detailed information.

properties.name: CfgUnitTemplates
properties.description: This class is used to create units templates. For now, this is only used with the function BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear.

properties.name: CfgVehicles
properties.description:
This class can only be used to create sound sources (since Arma 3 v1.69.141183).
See also CfgSFX for more detailed information.

properties.name: CfgVehicleTemplates
properties.description: This class is used to create vehicle templates used by the Vehicle Customization system.

properties.name: rscTitles
properties.description: Defines custom UI displays. To show such displays, use cutRsc or titleRsc.
